intro: Geniostoma saipanense, commonly known as the Saipan starling plant, is a flowering plant native to the Caroline Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a rough texture. It plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest to botanists studying tropical flora.
